definition: to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: Article 66 The trustee of a public trust must not resign without the approval of the regulatory agency of public undertakings.
sentences.chinese: 信托的受托人未经公益事业管理机构批准，不得辞任。

sentences.english: The president will soon retire from office.
Where there are other provisions in this Law governing the resignation of the trustee of a public welfare trust, those provisions shall prevail.
sentences.chinese: 本法对公益信托的受托人辞任另有规定的，从其规定。

sentences.english: After standing down as the chairman of the company, he will stay as an advisor.
sentences.chinese: 辞任公司主席后，他会留下来作顾问。

definition: to remain in office/to hold on to one's job

pinyin: nian2 du4 gu3 dong1 da4 hui4
gu3 dong1 te4 bie2 da4 hui4

definition: to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time

pinyin: quan2 zi1 fu4 shu3 gong1 si1

definition: Hong Kong Stock Exchange/abbr. for 香港交易所
to own a controlling number of shares in a company
